data.text:
Alberto Giacometti, the twentieth century painter and sculptor, the Surrealist artist and the Expressionist pioneer created some of the most striking art pieces through his entire journey. His sculptures shaped the surreal approach incorporating nuanced themes of Freudian psychoanalysis and his obsessions with trauma and anxiety coupled with alienation rendered his works in an entirely otherworldly representation. Alberto Giacometti’s later works shaped his endeavors in the Expressionist approach. His works in figurations were also unique; he rendered the pieces with distinctive approach, distorting the paintings to shape them in his signature representations. Some of the sculptural works he created had the influence of the primitive art yet they at times resembled toys or games as well as architectural models. 1930s onwards Alberto Giacometti abandoned abstraction and surrealism to turn towards Figuration and he shaped some of the groundbreaking ideas of Expressionism. His works centered upon the spatial distances of the subjects from its maker. These sculptures and paintings by Alberto Giacometti are available online for you to check out once. Alberto Giacometti’s later works were characterized by the references of war and his post-war art introduced an entirely new language of art. Through this new language of Alberto Giacometti he rendered the figures that he created in an illusion of real space. This absolutely new representation of spatiality impressed many of the writers of his time. Authors who centered their works around Phenomenology and existentialism during the time were immensely influenced by Alberto Giacometti’s expressions of the figures that he created. The two philosophies, Existentialism and Phenomenology, were based on the concepts of self-consciousness as well as how the spectators as well as the creator relate to the other human beings. In short, he represented the interactions between self and the other. Alberto Giacometti’s art was considered to be thoroughly capturing the tone of anxiety, alienation melancholy and loneliness. The paintings and sculptures he developed ranged between the many themes that can be traced back to these basic concepts. Alberto Giacometti’s paintings showcased online relate to the distinguished form of painterly styles that he developed. His Surrealist sculptures and the abstract paintings define the early days of his journey as much as the expressionist elements in his later life.
